CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ruth Price, housekeeper, Presto and Mrs. Mary Stephens, housewife, Schenley Heights, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 23, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think race relations are improving or worsening in Pittsburgh?" Mrs. Ruth Price's answer reads: "It's hard to say about Pittsburgh.  In some places, they are improving, and in others, they are not.  For instance, at work, I get along fine with everybody except one person.  In Presto, where I live, the majority of families are white and we, all of us, get along fine."  Mrs. Mary Stephens' answer reads: I don't see where they are getting any better."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ruth Price wearing eyeglasses and houndstooth coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Mary Stephens wearing light colored coat with three buttons, holding boy wearing tweed hat and coat, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
